text: hi everyone
tomthinnyskoomtano here the internet's
busiest music nerd and it's time for a
review of this new hudson mohawk album
cry sugar this is the latest full-length
lp from scottish born producer hudson
mohawk his fourth formal commercial
album to date which comes shortly after
a run of very chaotic short form
projects which essentially functioned as
a mass dissemination of
older tracks and songs in the hudson
catalog that have that have yet to kind
of land on a formal project one might
presume after so many wild collections
of cuts that the next hudson album would
be something more paired down focused
but chris sugar is the exact opposite
really it's hud mo's most long versatile
and out of control record yet with its
19 tracks and 63 minutes of run time it
covers quite a few bases but therein
lies the issue with this album there is
absolutely positively no direction to it
whatsoever not just in terms of genre
but also mood the whole thing runs more
like a compilation than anything one
moment you may get a very peppy and
colorful display of trap beats and
bright 80 synths the next you're getting
a very chilling ambient piece like in
the case of the super eerie k-pipe
further down the line it's bumping
hip-hop beats and some soul vocal chops
and then maybe you get a track that
sounds like the menu screen music to a
very hopeful and uplifting indie game
like with the track is it supposed you
could get a tiny interlude that adds
little to nothing to the unpredictable
flow of this record or maybe a lengthier
cut that sort of overstays its welcome
some tracks here develop quite a bit
others not as much like the song redeem
as well as lonely days which i wish did
more with its mountains of minimalist
string section tension there are kind of
ordinary cuts on this thing that are
shoulder to shoulder with
uncompromisingly experimental moments
too like the song stump which features
all of these van gelis-esque synth
builds but the effects and synth patches
on the track are so distorted and the
effects are so heavy-handed that the
whole thing progressively becomes more
and more deafening and overwhelming
track to track to track the sound you
are going to get and whether or not
you're going to enjoy it is really a
crap shoot which does make the overall
listening experience kind of shoddy but
that does not mean that this record
isn't without its highlights as hudson
mohawk does have quite a few strokes of
genius on this record and i think you
would have to in order for it to
translate out of this very chaotic track
list like the grand string kissed intro
for example there's intentions which is
one of the most fun and ingeniously
jittery dance tracks i've heard this
year which is also the case for bixstan
but in this instance these synthesizers
are even catchier we also have dance
forever whose rhythms and atmosphere
resemble that of a throwback 80s like
base style dance and hip hop track with
a lot of rollins style rhythms those
classic 808s as well but then the vocal
chops and somewhat unsettling and
dissonant synth leads that pop in here
and there uh make the whole sensation
feel warped and odd mutant the hip hop
beats glamorous instrumentation and
throwback vocal chops on three sheets to
the wind are a pretty tried and true
formula but hudson mohawk throws in a
lot of subtle
weird qualities to it so that it's a
very specifically him you know putting
his thumbprint on the whole thing and
tincture has really neat and groovy
intense two-step rhythm to it topped
with all of these insane disorienting
bits of vocal
uh there's so many good tracks on this
thing that are just dying to be played
in the club but
simultaneously there are just as many
songs on this project that are just okay
or don't go far enough i'm sure some of
you have heard the old adage about not
putting all of your eggs in one basket i
feel like this record has the opposite
problem there's too much effort and too
much artistry being spread out among so
many tracks
some of which i think could have been
amended or changed or built upon had
there been more focus on them had we got
them in a tighter track list that needed
to flow a bit more functionally but
instead with cry sugar what we end up
getting is what sounds like a kind of
left field base wonky and trap playlist
put on shuffle with a super unique
banger occasionally popping up here and
there i'm feeling a decent two strong
six on this one tran position have you
given this album a listen did you love
it did you hate it what would you rate
it you're the best you're the best what
should i review next hit the like if you
like please subscribe and please don't
cry hit the bell as well over here next
to my head is another video that you can
check out hit that up or the link to
subscribe to the channel anthony fantano
hudson mohawk forever
